name: Lego Lab
description: With Legos, you can build anything you can imagine and tell any story you can dream up. Come to the Lego Lab to hear, see, make, and create different stories, all while building with Legos provided by the Library! Program length can vary, please call branch for details.

name: Crafternoon
description: Drop by the library and make a craft while you search for books, movies and music. We've got paper crafts, easy sewing and more fun projects for the whole family. We provide the supplies; you provide the creativity. Program length is approximately 1 hour.

name: The Crafty Adult
subtitle: formerly known as Night Crafters
description: Are you a crafter? Do you wish you were a crafter? We’ll focus on a different craft every month; we’ll learn the basics, we’ll learn the ins and outs, and then we’ll let loose. Come learn with us!
main_image_alt: Crafty Adult Logo on a black and green gradient background

name: Meet the Author
description: Meet the Author events provide an opportunity to hear a writer read their work aloud and discuss it with an audience.

name: Basic Computer Skills
description: Learn everything you need to know to start using a computer, from how to use a mouse and keyboard to an introduction to the internet. No prerequisites.

name: Computación Basica
description: Aprenda todo lo que necesita saber para comenzar a usar una computadora, desde cómo usar el ratón y el teclado, para una introducción de la internet.

name: Computer and Job Searching Lab
description: Get help with your job search and/or bring your questions about basic computer skills including how to use the internet, email, and Microsoft Word and related topics. No prerequisites.

name: Tech Time
description: Learn to download books and use digital Library resources. Bring in your tablet, smartphone or eReader for help navigating the Virtual Library, downloading eBooks, audiobooks, digital magazines and more! Tech Time sessions take place at various Austin Public Library locations throughout town. Drop in anytime during the session. The estimated setup time for each device is about 20 minutes.

name: Controversy & Conversation
description:
A series of documentaries about the most controversial issues of the day. Screenings are followed by moderated discussion. Refreshments are served prior to the film and seating begins at 6 PM.

In partnership with the UT Austin Humanities Institute.

name: Chess Club
description: Learn to play chess! Children under 10 must be accompanied by an adult.

name: Practiquemos Español
description: Practiquemos Español is not a Spanish class, but rather a place to fine-tune your Spanish in a relaxed environment under the guidance of a Spanish-speaking facilitator. Participants will need to know a little Spanish to participate.

name: ¡Qué me cuentas!
description: Practice and learn Spanish as a second language with ¡Qué me cuentas! Through reading and discussion of Latin-American short stories and newspapers, this group offers a unique way to practice Spanish for more advanced speakers. 40% proficiency in Spanish is preferred.

name: Talk Time
description:
Improve your English conversation. ¡Mejore su conversación en inglés!

Talk Time is a program for English conversation practice with other English language learners and English speaking volunteers. No registration is necessary. The program is open to any adult who speaks some English and wants an informal and safe place to practice with others.

Participe en Talk Time: Hablemos Inglés, un programa gratis de La Biblioteca Pública de Austin, donde usted puede venir a conversar en inglés y así practicar y sentirse más seguro. No es necesario registrarse. Este programa se ofrece a cualquier adulto que hable algo de inglés y que quiera practicarlo con otros en un lugar informal y sin presiones.
main_image_alt: lips speaking word bubbles containing the "TALK TIME" brand identity.

name: Literature Live!
subtitle: Jack and the Beanstalk
description: When hungry, young Jack trades the family cow for a peddler’s beans, a giant beanstalk leads him to adventure in the castle of a giant and his mother. What happens next will surprise you! Join us for this not-so-traditional puppet show. Recommended for ages 4 and up.
main_image_alt: Jack on the giant beanstalk way above the clouds, with a starry sky and a bright moon in the background..

name: Movies
description: Join us for a movie screening. Watch and discover new films at the Austin Public Library.

name: Minecraft
description: Join us for Minecraft free play! Laptops are available. You can also bring your own or other mobile device that has Minecraft downloaded!

name: Bizaid Business Orientation
description: BizAid Orientation provides a general overview on how to open a small business or re-imagine an existing one. Learn how to find assistance at the idea, start-up and existing stages of your business. We will cover key questions entrepreneurs should ask as well as how to find answers and business solutions. BizAid Orientation is free and open to the public, but space is limited so you must register.

name: All Ages Storytime
description: Storytime for children aged 5 and under and their parents, featuring stories, songs, fingerplays, rhymes, and crafts or other extension activities. Program length can vary.

name: Books and Babies
description: A lapsit storytime program especially for non-walking babies 0-18 months and their caregivers.  Very short stories are interspersed with songs, rhymes, and fingerplays for babies and parents.  A brief playtime follows. Program length can vary.

name: Spanish-English Storytime
description:
All ages storytime which uses both English and Spanish to present books, rhymes and songs. It differs from a traditional bilingual storytime in that some material is presented in English while other material is presented in Spanish, allowing for a natural transition between stories and activities and exposing children to both languages in an inviting environment. Program length can vary.

Esta hora del cuento es para niños y niñas desde bebitos hasta de edad escolar y para sus padres. Se presentarán libros, rimas, y canciones en inglés y en español. Difiere de un programa tradicionalmente bilingüe en que el material no va a ser traducido de un idioma al otro, sino que presentaremos algunas cosas en inglés y otras en español empapando a los niños en los dos idiomas. De esta manera ellos se sentirán cómodos usando los dos idiomas. Recomendado para niños y niñas menores de 5 años.

name: Pajama Storytime
description: Feel free to wear pajamas to this family storytime in the evening featuring stories, songs, rhymes, games, crafts, and other activities. Program length can vary.

name: Preschool Storytime
description: Storytime for preschoolers aged 3-5 and their parents featuring stories, songs, fingerplays, rhymes, and crafts. Program length can vary.

name: Toddler Storytime
description: A storytime program designed for toddlers aged 18 months to 3 years and their parents, featuring stories, songs, fingerplays, and games. Program length can vary.

name: Music
description: Practice music at your neighborhood Library.

name: Conversation Café
description: Hungry for conversation? Drop in for open, public dialogue on a variety of topics and add to the diversity of perspectives.

name: Open Mic
description:
The Austin Public Library Hosts Open Mics at various locations. 

Join our Open Mic Facebook Group for regular updates!

name: FixIt Clinic
description: Fixit Clinics are all about do-it-together, hands-on disassembly, troubleshooting and learning to repair.

name: French-English Storytime
description:
Bonjour and welcome to this très special storytime! This is a dual language storytime for children aged 5 and under and their caregivers, featuring stories, songs, fingerplays, rhymes, and other pre-literacy skill building activities in both English and Français. Join us, s'il vous plaît!

Some material is presented in English while other material is presented in French, allowing for a natural transition between stories and activities and exposing children to both languages in an inviting environment. Storytime lasts about 30 minutes.

name: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe Tournament
description:
Compete in the Austin Public Library’s Annual Winter Gaming Tournament.

Doors open for sign-ups 30 minutes before each tournament and the first 32 people to sign up will be assured a spot. Controllers will be provided but you may also bring your own. All dates are seed tournaments for the Grand Championship at the Central Library on January 5, 2020 at 2 PM.  Program length is approximately two hours. 

Something for the whole family! Tournament now played with Mario Kart 8 Deluxe on the SWITCH.

name: Super Smash Bros Tournament
description: Are you ready to smash? Compete in the annual Super Smash Bros. for Wii U Summer tournament. All dates are seed tournaments for the Championship finals at the Central Library on August 14. Sign-up begins 30 minutes prior to start time. The first 32 people to sign up are guaranteed a spot to play.  Controllers will be provided but you may also bring your own. Program length is approximately 2 hours.

name: Winter Cheer Celebrations
subtitle: Holidays, Festivities and More!
description: Come celebrate the holidays with the Austin Public Library!
main_image_alt: Text with golden glitter effect, that reads "Winter Cheer Celebrations", with a halved snowflake centered above, on a magical wintery background of blurred snowflakes, light flares and a gradient of color from a deep blue to golden light orange/yellow.

name: Spanish Storytime
description:
Storytime in Spanish or presented bilingually in Spanish and English / Una hora de cuentos bilingües o en español para toda la familia

Program length can vary. Programs begin on time, for best experience we recommend you do too! Please arrive a few minutes early to gain entrance. Note that in some locations, free tickets (available in the branch on the day of the program) will be required for admittance. Contact individual branches to arrange group visits of 5 or more children to storytimes.

Recomendado para niños y niñas menores de 5 años. Recomendamos que llegue a tiempo, ya que las horas de cuentos comienzan precisamente a la hora programada. Para asegurar tener asiento, por favor llegue unos cuantos minutos antes del comienzo. En algunos locales se requiere tener boleto para entrar (lo puede obtener gratuitamente el mimso día del programa en la sucursal). Llame a la sucursal para hacer arreglos para traer grupos de 5 niños o más a la hora de cuentos.

name: Business Workshops
description: Austin Public Library has many resources for starting a business, such as online databases and workshops led by business professionals.

name: Kids Summer
subtitle: Summer at Austin Public Library
description:
This summer, we encourage you to read, learn, and earn free prizes! Find more information here. 

We also have free and fun events for kids ages 6-10 all summer long! Due to popular demand, some programs may require a ticket for entry. Please call your local library branch for more details!
main_image_alt: Summer at Austin Public Library, blue with fern

name: Teen Summer
subtitle: Summer at Austin Public Library
description:
This summer, we encourage you to read, learn, and earn free prizes! Find more information here. 

We also have free and fun events for teens ages 13-17 all summer long! Due to popular demand, some programs may require a ticket for entry. Please call your local library branch for more details!
main_image_alt: Summer at Austin Public Library, green cactus

name: Summer for Adults
subtitle: Summer at Austin Public Library
description:
This summer, we encourage you to read, learn, and earn free prizes! Find more information here. 

We also have free and fun events for adults all summer long! Due to popular demand, some programs may require a ticket for entry. Please call your local library branch for more details!
main_image_alt: Summer at Austin Public Library, yellow plant

name: Music & Movement
description: Bring your favorite little one to stretch, sing, dance & explore music with rhythm instruments! Program length can vary. Focuses on the Sing and Play recommendations for early literacy which helps develops gross motor skills, listening skills, and social skills, while introducing new vocabulary.

name: Japanese-English Storytime
description:
This is a dual language storytime for children aged 5 and under and their caregivers, featuring stories, songs, fingerplays, rhymes, and other pre-literacy skill building activities in both English and Japanese.

Some material is presented in English while other material is presented in Japanese, allowing for a natural transition between stories and activities and exposing children to both languages in an inviting environment. Storytime lasts about 30 minutes.

name: Board Games
description: Join us for playing a variety of board games.

name: Yoga Storytime
description:
Practice your mindfulness, hear a story, and learn more about yoga. No mat is required. / Practique como mantenerse enfocado, escuche un cuento, y aprenda más sobre la práctica de Yoga. No necesita traer un tapete para yoga.

Programs begin on time, for best experience we recommend you do too! Please arrive a few minutes early to gain entrance. Note that in some locations, free tickets (available in the branch on the day of the program) will be required for admittance. Contact individual branches to arrange group visits of 5 or more children to storytimes.

name: Early Literacy Playgroup
description: Playing is learning! Play is a great way to help develop and reinforce early literacy skills. This come-and-go program is designed to give caregivers and their children time to explore together. Toys, board books, and a weekly craft will be provided.

name: Chinese Mandarin-English Storytime
description: This all-ages storytime uses both Chinese Mandarin and English to present books, rhymes, finger-plays, and songs. Materials are not necessarily translated. The storytime flows naturally using both languages, allowing children to feel comfortable in a multilingual environment. No prior experience with Chinese is necessary to participate in.

name: Tween Summer
description:
This summer, we encourage you to read, learn, and earn free prizes! Find more information here. 

We also have free and fun events for tweens ages 9-12 all summer long! Due to popular demand, some programs may require a ticket for entry. Please call your local library branch for more details!
main_image_alt: Summer at Austin Public Library, purple with plant
